intro: Baltimora scolospermum var. panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian baltimora, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from violet to deep purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks and in tropical forests. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
